New Records: Juan Soto hit his 39th home run of the season, reaching 100 RBIs for the third time in his career.
Juan Soto's home run was the 544th curveball allowed by Cole Ragans in his major league career, breaking a streak of 543 curveballs without a home run.
Key Match Events: Juan Soto's two-run home run in the sixth inning was the game-changing moment that shifted momentum to the Yankees.
The game went into 11 innings before Jazz Chisholm Jr. delivered a walk-off hit.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone praised Juan Soto's resilience after the injury scare and subsequent home run.
Juan Soto expressed relief and frustration, focusing on his ability to come through in the clutch.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees' win gave them a 1.5-game lead in the American League East with 16 games remaining.
The game's outcome had significant implications for the Yankees' playoff push.
